meanings.definition: The act of renouncing or rejecting something formally.
meanings.sent1: Her abjurations of unhealthy habits led to a happier life.
meanings.sent2: The abjurations of allegiance were heard throughout the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: After many abjurations, he finally gave up his favorite dessert.
meanings.sent4: His abjurations of the old ways opened up new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The abjurations of the past echoed in his mind, urging him to move forward.

meanings.definition: A solemn oath or declaration renouncing something.
meanings.sent1: She took her abjurations seriously, never breaking a promise.
meanings.sent2: The abjurations made at the ceremony were heartfelt and sincere.
meanings.sent3: His abjurations to always tell the truth were put to the test.
meanings.sent4: In his abjurations, he vowed to never repeat his mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The abjurations spoken under the ancient tree carried great weight and importance.
